snippet: Gov. Chris Christie issued a directive on Monday saying that the state would not prosecute casinos and racetracks for accepting wagers on most athletic contests.
abstract: Gov Chris Christie issues directive saying that New Jersey will not prosecute casinos and racetracks for accepting wagers on most athletic contests in effort to aid New Jersey's ailing casino industry; racetracks and casinos seem caught off guard by announcement, as are federal officials; professional sports leagues who have been fighting Christie administration in court say they have no plans to begin offering sports betting.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie issued a directive on Monday saying that the state would not prosecute casinos and racetracks for accepting wagers on most athletic contests.

headline.print_headline: Christie Unilaterally Lifts Prohibition on Sports Betting
